title: 美國知名歷史學家警告：「拜登若當選恐爆發對中戰爭」

replies.msg:
美中情勢緊繃，史丹佛大學胡佛研究所資深成員尼爾弗格森（Niall Ferguson）在《彭博》撰文指出，綜觀過去戰爭史，弗格森認為民主黨的拜登當選更容易觸發戰爭，因為美國對中國的技術封鎖，讓台灣成為核心導火線。

弗格森主張，在美國2黨都對中國不滿的前提下，真正讓中國無法忍受的，不是美中貿易戰的關稅、美國對中國企業、打壓香港、維吾爾族的種種制裁手段，或因武漢肺炎究責，而是技術封鎖，尤其美國擴大封殺華為，而其中的核心導火線恐怕就是台灣。

弗格森表示，疫情延燒各地，在歷史上難以維持和平，目前世界各地的動亂就是例證。他認為美、中兩國早已處於冷戰的情勢，如同14、15世紀的英、法國，當時也不會有人意識到自己處於「百年戰爭」中。

弗格森強調，川普堅守共和黨「不輕易發動戰爭」的傳統，拜登幾乎不談外交，而且20世紀以來，民主黨其實更容易讓美國陷入戰爭之中，因此佛格森也認為，比起川普，拜登更容易觸發戰爭的可能。

https://www.ftvnews.com.tw/news/detail/2020824W0126

樓豬其實唔駛帶風向, 連登本身就已經係全面共識支持拜登,
話晒拜登都係聯登既一部份, 我地豈有不支持既理由,
至於廢侵, 叫佢食屎啦
拜登又贏
大勝吧，拜登
打呀

quote.msg:
美中情勢緊繃，史丹佛大學胡佛研究所資深成員尼爾弗格森（Niall Ferguson）在《彭博》撰文指出，綜觀過去戰爭史，弗格森認為民主黨的拜登當選更容易觸發戰爭，因為美國對中國的技術封鎖，讓台灣成為核心導火線。

弗格森主張，在美國2黨都對中國不滿的前提下，真正讓中國無法忍受的，不是美中貿易戰的關稅、美國對中國企業、打壓香港、維吾爾族的種種制裁手段，或因武漢肺炎究責，而是技術封鎖，尤其美國擴大封殺華為，而其中的核心導火線恐怕就是台灣。

弗格森表示，疫情延燒各地，在歷史上難以維持和平，目前世界各地的動亂就是例證。他認為美、中兩國早已處於冷戰的情勢，如同14、15世紀的英、法國，當時也不會有人意識到自己處於「百年戰爭」中。

弗格森強調，川普堅守共和黨「不輕易發動戰爭」的傳統，拜登幾乎不談外交，而且20世紀以來，民主黨其實更容易讓美國陷入戰爭之中，因此佛格森也認為，比起川普，拜登更容易觸發戰爭的可能。

https://www.ftvnews.com.tw/news/detail/2020824W0126

不過是旦search完 wiki都好似幾燈下
//Trump election
On the rise of Republican Party presidential candidate Donald Trump, Ferguson was quoted in early 2016: "If you bother to read some of the serious analysis of Trump's support, you realize that it's a very fragile thing and highly unlikely to deliver what he needs in the crucial first phase of the primaries ... By the time we get to March–April, it's all over. I think there's going to be a wonderful catharsis, I'm really looking forward to it: Trump's humiliation. Bring it on."[112] Trump eventually won the nomination.

Three weeks before the 2016 United States presidential election, after the Access Hollywood tape scandal, Ferguson stated in an interview that it "was over for Donald Trump"; that "Trump had flamed out in all three Presidential debates"; that, "I don't think there can be any last minute surprise to rescue him [Trump]"; that there was no hope of Donald Trump winning Independent voters and that Trump was "gone as a candidate", adding that "it seems to me clear that she [Hillary Clinton] is going to be the first female President of the United States. The only question is how bad does his [Trump's] flaming out affect candidates for the Senate, candidates for the House, further down on the ballot."[113] However after Brexit, Ferguson stated that Trump could win via the Electoral College if certain demographics turned out to vote in key swing states.(阿媽係女人啦屌你)[114] Trump was elected president and the Republican Party retained control of both the Senate and House of Representatives.

Trump's "New World Order"
In an article from November 2016 in The Boston Globe, Ferguson advised that Trump should support the efforts of Prime Minister Theresa May to have Britain leave the European Union as the best way of breaking up the EU, and sign a free trade agreement with the United Kingdom once Brexit is complete.[115] Ferguson advised that Trump should give recognition to Russia as a Great Power, and work with President Vladimir Putin by giving Russia a sphere of influence in Eurasia.[115] In the same column, Ferguson advised Trump not to engage in a trade war with China, and work with President Xi Jinping to create a US-Chinese partnership.[115] Ferguson argued that Trump and Putin should work for the victory of Marine Le Pen (who wants France to leave the EU) and the Front national in the 2017 French elections, arguing that Le Pen was the French politician most congenial to the Trump administration.[115] Ferguson argued that a quintumvirate of Trump, Putin, Xi, May and Le Pen was the world's best hope for peace and prosperity.[115]//
